member.name: T:NodeNetwork.NNViewRegistrar
member.summary: A locator is used to find the correct view corresponding to a viewmodel. In ReactiveUI, usually Splat is used, but others exist. This class acts as an intermediate registrar. It gathers registrations and registers them to the preferred locator.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.NNViewRegistrar.RegisterSplat
member.summary: Register all NodeNetwork view/viewmodel pairs to Locator.CurrentMutable.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.Utilities.LongestCommonSubsequence.ChangeType
member.summary: The type of change that occured.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.Utilities.LongestCommonSubsequence.GetChanges``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0})
member.summary: Returns the changes to be made to oldList to reach the state of newList. First all items that are in oldList but not in the LCS of oldList and newList are removed. The list is then identical to the LCS of oldList and newList. Then all items that are in newList but not in the LCS of oldList and newList are added. The list is then identical to newList.
member.typeparam: The type of items contained in the two lists
member.param: The first list
The second list

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.Utilities.LongestCommonSubsequence.Calculate``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0})
member.summary: Returns the longest common subsequence of two lists For example: the LCS of 'computer' and 'houseboat' is 'out'
member.typeparam: The type of items contained in the two lists
member.param: The first list
The second list
member.returns: An enumerable of items that are both in seq1 and seq2 and which follows the consecutive order of both lists

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.Utilities.ReactiveExtensions.ThrottleWhen``1(System.IObservable{``0},System.IObservable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Pass through values if and only if the last value produced by 'throttleCondition' is false. When 'throttleCondition' is false, no values are passed through. When 'throttleCondition' changes from true to false, if one or more values was blocked during the period in which the throttle was active, the latest value will be passed through.
member.param: The source observable
An observable of booleans that determines the current throttle state

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.Utilities.ReactiveExtensions.BindList``4(``0,``1,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``1,DynamicData.IObservableList{``2}}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``3}})
member.summary: Create a one way list binding from the viewmodel to the view. The view list property will be automatically updated to reflect the viewmodel source list property.
member.typeparam: The type of the data stored in the list
The type of the target property in the view
member.param: The view used for the binding
A dummy viewmodel parameter, used to infer the viewmodel type
The source property in the viewmodel that contains the list
The target property in the view to bind the list to.
member.returns: An object that when disposed, disconnects the binding.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.Utilities.ReactiveExtensions.PairWithPreviousValue``1(System.IObservable{``0})
member.summary: Takes an observable of T values and returns an observable of tuples of T values containing the latest value and the previous value. The first item in the source observable produces a tuple with the previous value set to default(T).
member.typeparam: The type of object in the observable
member.param: The source observable

member.summary: Gets or sets the current canvas drag offset.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas.DragStartEventHandler
member.summary: Triggered when the user clicks and moves the canvas, starting a drag
member.param: The dragcanvas that triggered this event
The mouseevent that triggered this event

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas.DragMoveEventHandler
member.summary: Triggered when the user drags the canvas
member.param: The dragcanvas that triggered this event
Contains the distance traveled since the last drag move or drag start event

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas.DragEndEventHandler
member.summary: Triggered when the user releases the mouse and the drag stops.
member.param: The dragcanvas that triggered this event
Contains the total distance traveled

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas.StartDragGesture
member.summary: This mouse gesture starts a drag on the canvas. Left click by default.

member.name: F:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas._userClickedThisElement
member.summary: Used when the mousebutton is down to check if the initial click was in this element. This is useful because we dont want to assume a drag operation when the user moves the mouse but originally clicked a different element

member.name: F:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas._dragActive
member.summary: Is a drag operation currently in progress?

member.name: F:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas._originScreenCoordPosition
member.summary: The position of the mouse (screen co-ordinate) where the mouse was clicked down.

member.name: F:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas._previousMouseScreenPos
member.summary: The position of the mouse (screen co-ordinate) when the previous DragDelta event was fired

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas.OnMouseDown(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: This event puts the control into a state where it is ready for a drag operation.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas.OnMouseMove(System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Trigger a dragging event when the user moves the mouse while the left mouse button is pressed

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.Views.Controls.DragCanvas.OnMouseUp(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Stop dragging when the user releases the mouse button

member.summary: Centers the canvas and sets the minimum zoom factor for the specified viewport.
member.param: The desired viewport.

member.summary: NetworkView

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.Views.NetworkView.NetworkViewportRegion
member.summary: The rectangle to use as a clipping mask for contentContainer

member.name: E:NodeNetwork.Views.NetworkView.NodeMoveStart
member.summary: Occurs when a (set of) node(s) is selected and starts moving.

member.name: E:NodeNetwork.Views.NetworkView.NodeMove
member.summary: Occurs one or more times as the mouse changes position when a (set of) node(s) is selected and has mouse capture.

member.name: E:NodeNetwork.Views.NetworkView.NodeMoveEnd
member.summary: Occurs when a (set of) node(s) loses mouse capture.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.Views.NetworkView.CanvasOriginElement
member.summary: The element that is used as an origin for the position of the elements of the network.
member.example:
Can be used for calculating the mouse position relative to the network.
Mouse.GetPosition(network.CanvasOriginElement)

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.Views.NetworkView.StartCutGesture
member.summary: This mouse gesture starts a cut, making the cutline visible. Right click by default.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.Views.NetworkView.StartSelectionRectangleGesture
member.summary: This mouse gesture starts a selection, making the selection rectangle visible. Left click + Shift by default.

member.summary: InitializeComponent

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ValidationResult
member.summary: A class that represents a generic validation result.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ValidationResult.IsValid
member.summary: True if the subject is valid

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ValidationResult.MessageViewModel
member.summary: A viewmodel of the message that is to be displayed explaining this validation result.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.NetworkValidationResult
member.summary: A validation of the node network.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.NetworkValidationResult.NetworkIsTraversable
member.summary: If false, the network is in a state where trying to parse it (by walking from node to node) can cause problems. For example, this property is false if the network contains loops since parsing it could then result in infinite loops.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ConnectionValidationResult
member.summary: A validation of a connection between nodes.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ConnectionViewModel
member.summary: Represents a connection between a node input and a node output

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ConnectionViewModel.Parent
member.summary: The network that contains this connection

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ConnectionViewModel.Input
member.summary: The viewmodel of the node input that is on one end of the connection.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ConnectionViewModel.Output
member.summary: The viewmodel of the node output that is on one end of the connection.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ConnectionViewModel.CanBeRemovedByUser
member.summary: If false, the user cannot delete this connection. True by default.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ConnectionViewModel.IsHighlighted
member.summary: If true, the connection is highlighted.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ConnectionViewModel.IsInErrorState
member.summary: If true, the connection is displayed as being in an erroneous state.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ConnectionViewModel.IsMarkedForDelete
member.summary: If true, the connection is displayed as being marked for deletion.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.CutLineViewModel
member.summary: Viewmodel class for the UI cutting line that is used to delete connections.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.CutLineViewModel.StartPoint
member.summary: The coordinates of the point at which the cutting line starts.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.CutLineViewModel.EndPoint
member.summary: The coordinates of the point at which the cutting line ends.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.CutLineViewModel.IsVisible
member.summary: If true, the cutting line is visible. If false, the cutting line is hidden.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.CutLineViewModel.IntersectingConnections
member.summary: A list of connections that visually intersect with the cutting line. This list is driven by the view.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortPosition
member.summary: Enum type that indicates the position of the port in the endpoint

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointVisibility
member.summary: Enum types that indicates the visibility behaviour of an endpoint

member.name: F:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointVisibility.Auto
member.summary: Automatically decide whether or not to show this endpoint based on the collapse status of the node

member.name: F:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointVisibility.AlwaysVisible
member.summary: Always show this endpoint, even if the node is collapsed

member.name: F:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointVisibility.AlwaysHidden
member.summary: Always hide this endpoint

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint
member.summary: Parent interface for the inputs/outputs of nodes between which connections can be made.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.Parent
member.summary: The node that owns this endpoint

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.Name
member.summary: The name of this endpoint. In the default view, this string is displayed in the node next to the port.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.Group
member.summary: The group the end point belongs to. Can be null.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.Icon
member.summary: The icon displayed near the endpoint label If this is null, no icon is displayed.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.Editor
member.summary: The editor viewmodel associated with this endpoint. It can be used to configure the behaviour of this endpoint or provide a default value when there is no connection. The editor, if not null, will be displayed in the node, under the endpoint name next to the port.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.Port
member.summary: The viewmodel for the port of this endpoint. (the part the user can create connections from.)

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.PortPosition
member.summary: Where should the port be positioned in the endpoint?

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.Connections
member.summary: List of connections between this endpoint and other endpoints in the network. To add a new connection, do not add it here but instead add it to the Connections property in the network.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.MaxConnections
member.summary: The maximum amount of connections this endpoint accepts. When Connections.Count == MaxConnections, the user cannot add more connections to this endpoint until a connection is removed.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.Visibility
member.summary: Visibility behaviour of this endpoint

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.Endpoint.SortIndex
member.summary: Inputs and outputs are sorted by increasing values of SortIndex before being displayed.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointGroupViewModel.VisibleInputs
member.summary: The list of inputs that is currently visible on this group. Some inputs may be hidden if the node is collapsed.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointGroupViewModel.VisibleOutputs
member.summary: The list of outputs that is currently visible on this group. Some outputs may be hidden if the node is collapsed.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointGroupViewModel.Group
member.summary: The endpoint group wrapping the name and the parent group of this group.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointGroupViewModel.Children
member.summary: The list of nested endpoint groups.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.EndpointGroupViewModelFactory
member.summary: The factory method to create endpoint view models. Used in NodeViewModel.
member.param: The endpoint group this view model wraps.
All inputs of the group.
All outputs of the group.
Nested endpoint groups.
The factory method used to create the nested endpoint group view models.
member.returns: The view model for the endpoint group.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ErrorMessageViewModel
member.summary: A viewmodel for a simple error message.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.ErrorMessageViewModel.Message
member.summary: The text to be displayed that explains the error.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel
member.summary: The viewmodel for node networks.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.Nodes
member.summary: The list of nodes in this network.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.SelectedNodes
member.summary: A list of nodes that are currently selected in the UI. The contents of this list is equal to the nodes in Nodes where the Selected property is true.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.Connections
member.summary: The list of connections in this network.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.PendingConnection
member.summary: The connection that is currently being build by the user. This connection is visually displayed in the UI, but is not an actual functional connection. This is used when the user drags from an endpoint to create a new connection.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.PendingNode
member.summary: The viewmodel of the node that is not part of the network, but is displayed as a node that can be added. This property is used to display a new node when the user drags a node viewmodel over the network view.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.ConnectionFactory
member.summary: The function that is used to create connection viewmodels when the user creates connections in the network view. By default, this function creates a ConnectionViewModel.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.Validator
member.summary: Function that is used to check if the network is valid or not. To run the validation, use the UpdateValidation command.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.LatestValidation
member.summary: The validation of the current state of the network. This property is automatically updated when UpdateValidation runs.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.Validation
member.summary: Observable that produces the latest NetworkValidationResult every time the network is validated.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.IsReadOnly
member.summary: If true, the network and its contents (nodes, connections, input/output editors, ...) cannot be modified by the user.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.CutLine
member.summary: The viewmodel of the cutline used in this network view.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.ZoomFactor
member.summary: Scale of the view. Larger means more zoomed in. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.MaxZoomLevel
member.summary: The maximum zoom level used in this network view. Default value is 2.5.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.MinZoomLevel
member.summary: The minimum zoom level used in this network view. Default value is 0.15.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.DragOffset
member.summary: The drag offset of the initial view position used in this network view. Default value is (0, 0).

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.SelectionRectangle
member.summary: The viewmodel for the selection rectangle used in this network view.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.ConnectionsUpdated
member.summary: This observable pushes a notification when a connection was added to/removed from the network, and the relevant endpoints have been updated.
member.remarks: Observing the Connections list directly will trigger the same notifications, but before the endpoints have had a chance to update and so they may be in an invalid state.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.NetworkChanged
member.summary: This observable pushes a notification whenever any functional changes are made to the network. Purely esthetical changes, such as the collapsing of nodes, do not trigger this observable.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.DeleteSelectedNodes
member.summary: Deletes the nodes in SelectedNodes that are user-removable.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.UpdateValidation
member.summary: Runs the Validator function and stores the result in LatestValidation.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.ClearSelection
member.summary: Clears SelectedNodes, setting the IsSelected property of all the nodes to false.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.StartCut
member.summary: Starts a cut in the CutLine viewmodel.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.FinishCut
member.summary: Stops the current cut in the CutLine viewmodel and applies the changes.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.RemovePendingConnection
member.summary: Sets PendingConnection to null.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.StartRectangleSelection
member.summary: Starts a selection in RectangleSelection

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NetworkViewModel.FinishRectangleSelection
member.summary: Stops the current selection in RectangleSelection and applies the changes.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeEndpointEditorViewModel
member.summary: The viewmodel for the editor component that is displayed next to a node endpoint.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeEndpointEditorViewModel.Parent
member.summary: The endpoint that has this object as its editor.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeInputViewModel
member.summary: Viewmodel class for inputs on a node. Inputs are endpoints that can only be connected to outputs.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeInputViewModel.IsEditorVisible
member.summary: If true, the editor is visible. Otherwise, the editor is hidden. See HideEditorIfConnected.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeInputViewModel.HideEditorIfConnected
member.summary: If true, the editor of this input will be hidden if Connection is not null. This makes sense if the editor is used to provide a value when no connection is present.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeInputViewModel.ConnectionValidator
member.summary: This function is called when a new connection with this input is pending. It decides whether or not the pending connection is valid. If the validation result says the pending connection is invalid, then the user will not be able to add the connection to the network.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeInputViewModel.CreatePendingConnection
member.summary: Sets the pending connection in the network to a new connection with this endpoint as the input. If this input already is connected, and MaxConnections == 1, then the connection is replaced by a pending connection without this endpoint. If the connection would be invalid, no pending connection is made. Called when the user clicks on this endpoint.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeInputViewModel.SetConnectionPreview(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets this endpoint as the input of the pending connection and updates its validation. Called when the user drags and holds a pending connection over this endpoint.
member.param: True to set this endpoint as the output of the pending connection. To remove this endpoint from the pending connection, set this to false.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeInputViewModel.FinishPendingConnection
member.summary: Tries to create a new connection in the network based on the pending connection and this endpoint as the input. If the connection would be invalid, no connection is made. The pending connection is deleted. Called when the user drags and releases a pending connection over this endpoint.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeOutputViewModel
member.summary: Viewmodel class for outputs on a node. Outputs are endpoints that can only be connected to inputs.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeOutputViewModel.CreatePendingConnection
member.summary: Sets the pending connection in the network to a new connection with this endpoint as the output. If the connection would be invalid, no pending connection is made. Called when the user clicks on this endpoint.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeOutputViewModel.SetConnectionPreview(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets this endpoint as the output of the pending connection and updates its validation. Called when the user drags and holds a pending connection over this endpoint.
member.param: True to set this endpoint as the output of the pending connection. To remove this endpoint from the pending connection, set this to false.

member.name: M:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeOutputViewModel.FinishPendingConnection
member.summary: Tries to create a new connection in the network based on the pending connection and this endpoint as the output. If the connection would be invalid, no connection is made. The pending connection is deleted. Called when the user drags and releases a pending connection over this endpoint.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel
member.summary: Viewmodel class for the nodes in the network

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.Parent
member.summary: The network that contains this node

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.Name
member.summary: The name of the node. In the default view, this string is displayed at the top of the node.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.HeaderIcon
member.summary: The icon displayed in the header of the node. If this is null, no icon is displayed. In the default view, this icon is displayed at the top of the node.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.Inputs
member.summary: The list of inputs on this node.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.Outputs
member.summary: The list of outputs on this node.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.VisibleInputs
member.summary: The list of inputs that is currently visible on this node. Some inputs may be hidden if the node is collapsed.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.VisibleOutputs
member.summary: The list of outputs that is currently visible on this node. Some outputs may be hidden if the node is collapsed.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.VisibleEndpointGroups
member.summary: The list of endpoint groups that is currently visible on this node. Some groups may be hidden if the node is collapsed.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.EndpointGroupViewModelFactory
member.summary: The function that is used to create endpoint group view models. By default, this function creates a EndpointGroupViewModel.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.IsSelected
member.summary: If true, this node is currently selected in the UI.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.IsCollapsed
member.summary: If true, this node is currently collapsed. If the node is collapsed, some parts of the node are hidden to provide a more compact view.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.CanBeRemovedByUser
member.summary: If true, the user can delete this node from the network in the UI. True by default.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.Position
member.summary: The position of this node in the network.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.Size
member.summary: The rendered size of this node.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.NodeViewModel.Resizable
member.summary: On which axes can the user resize the node?

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel
member.summary: Viewmodel for a connection that is currently being build by the user.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel.Parent
member.summary: The network viewmodel that this connection is being build in.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel.Input
member.summary: The node input viewmodel, if any, that is on one side of the connection. Can be null.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel.InputIsLocked
member.summary: If true, Input will not be changed. This is used to mark Input as the starting point of the pending connection.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel.Output
member.summary: The node output viewmodel, if any, that is on one side of the connection. Can be null.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel.OutputIsLocked
member.summary: If true, Output will not be changed. This is used to mark Output as the starting point of the pending connection.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel.LooseEndPoint
member.summary: The current coordinates of the point where the pending connection ends on the loose side. This value is used when the Input or Output is null.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel.BoundingBox
member.summary: The rectangle that contains the entire connection view.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PendingConnectionViewModel.Validation
member.summary: The validation of the current connection state. If invalid, the connection will be displayed as such and an error message will be displayed. The pending connection must be valid before it can be added to the network as a real connection.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel
member.summary: Viewmodel class for the UI part of an endpoint that is used to create connections.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.Parent
member.summary: The Endpoint that owns this port.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.CenterPoint
member.summary: The coordinates, relative to the network, of the center of this port. Used to draw connections.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.IsMirrored
member.summary: If true, the view for this viewmodel will be horizontally mirrored.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.IsVisible
member.summary: If true, this port is visible. If false, this port is hidden. True by default.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.IsHighlighted
member.summary: If true, this port is highlighted. This could be, for example, because the mouse is hovering over the port.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.IsInErrorMode
member.summary: If true, the port will visually indicate there is an error with this port. In the default view this is used to indicate a pending connection validation error.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.ConnectionDragStarted
member.summary: Observable that fires when the user starts a new pending connection from this port.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.ConnectionPreviewActive
member.summary: Fires when a pending connection is dragged over this port.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.PortViewModel.ConnectionDragFinished
member.summary: Fires when the user drops the pending connection on this port.

member.name: T:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.SelectionRectangleViewModel
member.summary: Viewmodel for the view that is used to select nodes by dragging a rectangle around them.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.SelectionRectangleViewModel.StartPoint
member.summary: The coordinates of the first corner of the rectangle (where the user clicked down).

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.SelectionRectangleViewModel.EndPoint
member.summary: The coordinates of the second corner of the rectangle.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.SelectionRectangleViewModel.Rectangle
member.summary: The Rect object formed by StartPoint and EndPoint.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.SelectionRectangleViewModel.IsVisible
member.summary: If true, the selection rectangle view is visible.

member.name: P:NodeNetwork.ViewModels.SelectionRectangleViewModel.IntersectingNodes
member.summary: List of nodes visually intersecting or contained in the rectangle. This list is driven by the view.
